caption: I had to visit the emergency room for the first time ever, and I was pleasantly surprised at the efficiency of this hospital. I've been living and working in France for four years now, and this was the best medical treatment I've ever had in Paris. I was admitted, treated, and given clearance to leave (with my full treatment plan) in less than 6 hours. The night nurses and doctors had incredible bedside manners. I highly recommend this hospital for emergency visits.

Was seen very quickly, amazing and professional staff. They did assessments and interventions in a timely manner, considering how busy it was. The service I received as an Ã©tranger was compassionate and warm, especially during a vulnerable time not in my own country. Thank you to the nurses, doctors, and transportation for a great experience!
Very large complex housing a large hospital in the original area of Paris. Clearly seen from the banks of the river.

We were on our way home after sightseeing and saw the sign, amazed about a hospital working since 651 AD! We stepped in to see  a very pretty garden and buildings from the 1800s, though not much info around, and only one person at a desk, offering no information. So we just wandered around for a few minutes. Still it was a nice respite from the busy streets outside.

Terrible. I had problem being in Paris. I went there to the Salle d'urgence. They did not tell me rhat I would have to pay and, after one month, I received to pay 1640 euro! Really bad service for europeans.

We had the chance to visit the Hotel Dieu during the Heritage Days this last September. We saw a beautiful building with a not less beautiful interior courtyard and an interesting little garden. It is 2 steps from Notre Dame de Paris (which you will certainly visit)

I was admitted to the emergency room where everything moved painfully slowly. For two hours, no one prescribed any painkillers. I was left alone in a room that smelled of urine. After two hours, I received negative test results that could have been handled in two minutes at a pharmacy. There were no doctors, only interns with attitudes, and they couldn't identify the issue. I left with the same pain.

I would not recommend this hospital if you are looking for any kind of walk-in care. I am fluent in basic French but have a limited medical vocabulary. The physician/interne I waited 2 hours to see seemed impatient, making little effort to indicate if she understood what I was saying (in French) about my injury or concerns. I know many of the other staff were able to speak English, but I was only met with someone who apparently didn't. I understand my injury may have been less severe than some of the other patients', but I would not have wasted vacation time in the middle of Paris at a hospital if I hadn't felt it was necessary. This intern walked out of the room rudely and left me to show myself out. I left Hotel-Dieu having made no progress in my injury with a bad taste in my mouth.
I had to go here for an emergency on New Years Day and the staff was very warm and courteous and helpful.

Im a tourist and I needed medical attention for post-operative (op was 2 weeks earlier) complications. all staff admin, nurses and doc very helpful and attentive and kind.  Hardly had to wait to my pleasant surprise! Merci merci beaucoup

Lousy patient care We were visiting Paris from Canada. My husband had ear pain and headache so we went to the emergency room of the hospital. The front desk personnel and the nurse were very helpful, they took care of us immediately; filled the forms, took the vitals in time etc.  Unfortunately my husband was in one of the examination rooms for over 2 hours because the doctor in charge, Dr A F, came a few times to the door of the examination room then left without talking to my husband and in the meantime she had time to spend chatting and walking down the hall and seemingly not examining patients in a timely manner nor in priority order when medical conditions are equal in seriousness.  In the end she did finally see my husband and prescribed some topical antibiotic which really did not help and was not necessarily efficacious.  I was disappointed by this medical care and did not expect it. I am a physician and  in my judgement it was unacceptable care.

On a week-long visit to Paris, my Son & I stayed on the 6th floor of the hospital which has been converted into guest rooms. We chose this place because if its unique place in history plus its location. One could not find a more ideal central spot to use as your base when visiting the City. City buses, trains & the Metro are all just a short walk from this hospital & imagine waking up to the bells of Notre Dame each day. Staff was wonderful. Accommodations were not fancy but were adequate & prices were competitive. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Hospital.

Accompanied my friend there for an STD check-up, because she has symptoms and doesn't speak french. The ladies at the counter were very rude and unfriendly. They were not inclined to help and basically just sent us away. Told us to book an appointment on doctolib even though none were available and their website said that when you have symptoms (which my friend definitely had) you can come get tested without an appointment. Very unpleasant experience especially considering that getting tested for STIs can always be stressful.

My mother and I went here 3 years ago now because she had a retinal tear in one of her eyes. Having had one before in the other eye she knew what it was and we saw this hospital has an emergency room specifically for eye issues. We waited around 5 or 6 hours to be seen since it was very busy but once seen the doctor spoke great English and confirmed she had a retinal tear. He told us to come back the next morning first thing to have the eye surgery to repair it. We came back the next morning and did not have to wait at all before our doctor (who seemed very young) came to get us and led us to the room. He sat my mother down, looked at her eye through a machine, told her not to move, and 15 seconds later was done. We came home and she waited for the extreme pain she had experienced with her other surgery. It never came. When she went home to the US she went to her eye dr and the dr told her the surgery had been done wonderfully. My mother asked why she had no pain and the dr told her they have new techniques and the best eye drâ€™s in the world in France. Oh and btw...the whole thing cost us â‚¬50!! Would definitely recommend this place.

The eye care section has some of the top surgeons in the world.  You need to reserve months in advance to have an eye exam, but the exams are extremely thorough.  They have all of the skills and tools to handle any condition.  They're the best.

Broke a bone falling off a trottinette, got in around 12nn and out by 3pm- in time to catch tgv back home. admitted, given first aid, X-rayed, bandaged up with a prescription to see a surgeon in 3 hours. With nice and professional doctors and staff. Makes you realise how top notch French health care is in Paris. They spoke English too for those who couldnâ€™t speak French. Bravo

The nurses and doctors there are really nice, they tried to ask some questions to make me calm down, and tested,my blood pressure at,the same time. The doctor came after a while, and diagnosed my injury. Luckily, it was not that bad.

What a gem! Fantastic history and a wide range of artefacts. Beautifully preserved. The guide â€˜telephonesâ€™ are a great idea but very long winded to the extent of becoming very boring! - This needs to be addressed immediately!
Great service, positively surprised. Super professional and friendly doctors and nurses. I didnâ€™t wait long. Immediately received and got best possible care.
Fell down the stairs during a vacation in Paris. The emergency is open 24hr. The stuff was very very nice. No wait. Was excepted as soon as i arrived. A++
Depressing place in a state of decay. Lots of mosquitoes in the rooms for patients. The lady at the admissions and cash counter rude
Neuroblastoma  tritmend on your hospital  oncology patients
Broke my wrist as a tourist, this hospital was wonderful to me, fixed me right up and did not charge me a penny. Superior care and very fine Doctors!
Had to visit this hospital on a trip to Paris, as my husband had a trapped nerve, no waiting & professional service & advice given. Very impressed
I gave 5 stars because of Dr ch. B. But you will have to wait until you get  tired before they could attend to you. Anyway it still the best
a) The didn't speak English b) The service was very slow on a day with no major cases or a lot of patients.
The doctor responsible for the vaccination unit claimed I didn't need a flu vaccin because there isn't any flu epidemic yet!!!??? Shame on you!
Very good place for something urgent.I cut my finger at work and they treated me nicely .
Very nice garden
Hospital is Good, Doctors are good but staffs are very very much rude and myself waited there for 4 hrs in order to see the doctor because of those rude staffs.
Nice
Visited the hotel and hospital several years ago with Riveria Travel and the gardens were beautiful and calm.
No one care about u in emergency room. Until the doctor come u may wait 3 or 4 hrs ðŸ‘Ž â€¦
It's a very good hospital and always well service.
i hate  that hospital; they makes me cry today; i will never go there; I HATE HATE IT SOOOOOOOOO MUCH
Great Public hospital in Paris! Quick service
Very helpful. Everyone is very kind..
Horrible.
